Menu/DifficultyMenu/GameDifficultyHeader: Game Difficulty options can be customized later through the in-game Settings Menu.
Menu/Escape/LeaveMultiplayerSessionWarni: Are you sure you wish to leave this multiplayer session?
Menu/Escape/NoHostOrClientMP: Not Hosting or Client in MP
Menu/Escape/QuitGameMultiplayerSessionWa: Are you sure you wish to Quit this multiplayer session?
Menu/Escape/QuitMultiplayerSessionWarnin: Multiplayer session will be closed for all players! Are you sure you wish to do this?
Menu/Escape/QuitReadOnlySessionWarning: Are you sure you wish to do this?
Menu/Escape/RevertToLaunchWarningModalMe: Your flight will be reverted to the Launchpad.
Menu/Escape/RevertToVABWarningModalMessa: Your flight will be reverted to the VAB.
Menu/Escape/SaveBeforeExitingGameWarning: Any unsaved progress will be lost! Save before exiting game?
Menu/Escape/SaveBeforeExitingWarning: Any unsaved progress will be lost! Save before exiting to main menu?
Menu/Game/BuildNotes:
Welcome to our MS13 build! This build represents continued improvements in many areas — particularly in VAB and Flight, which are now fully utilizing new UI architecture and styling, atmospheric drag, launch FX, and many rocket-building improvements 
  
  Much of the non-flight UI is placeholder and will be replaced in upcoming milestones — along with peripheral gameplay functions and systems you are familiar with from KSP 1.
Menu/Game/FTUEPrompt:
When enabled, you will receive additional information outside of tutorials that will explain features and concepts when first encountered.

Recommended if you are new to Kerbal Space Program or when trying new modes that introduce additional features.
Menu/KSC/Dock Description: Do you need to launch a vessel from the waters edge, you got it!
Menu/KSC/Launchpad 01 Description: The Launchpad is where vessels built in the VAB are launched.
Menu/KSC/Launchpad 02 Description: The Launchpad is where vessels built in the VAB are launched.
Menu/KSC/Launchpad 03 Description: The Launchpad is where vessels built in the VAB are launched.
Menu/KSC/Launchpad 04 Description: The Launchpad is where vessels built in the VAB are launched.
Menu/KSC/MissionControl Description: At Mission Control you can view and track all the missions that have been assigned to you.
Menu/KSC/Runway Description: This Runway has a long flat surface to reach takeoff speed so it’s perfect for spaceplanes!
Menu/KSC/TrackingStation Description: The Tracking Station is where you can view your spacecraft and other vehicles currently in-flight. You can also recover lander vessels and crew.
Menu/KSC/TrainingCenter Description: Aspire to space flight excellence at our top notch Training Center!
Menu/KSC/VAB Description: The VAB is where spacecraft are designed and built before being moved over to the launchpad for flight.
Menu/Launchpad/ConfirmRecoverMessage: Do you want to recover your vehicle?
Menu/Login/AlternateLoginInfo: If button doesn't work, enter the code below in the link provided:
Menu/Login/BrowserRedirectionInfo: You will be taken to your default external browser
Menu/Login/Log in PD info: Log in to your Private Division account to play online and sync cloud saves
Menu/Login/Logged in description: You can now play online multiplayer and sync cloud saves. Enjoy your game!
Menu/Main/PrivacyPolicyAcceptInfo: By clicking next, you acknowledge that you have read and understand the Privacy Policy
Menu/MainMenu/Quit warning: Do you really want to quit?
Menu/NewCampaign/Agency Flag and Colors: We set up the Kerbal Space Agency flag as your Agencys's flag and colors which will be displayed on your buildings and rocket parts.
Feel free to choose a different flag for your Agency if you like. If you decide later that your Agency flag and/or colors need a rebrand, you'll be able to change them in the game.
Menu/NewCampaign/Agency Name Menu Descri:
You are now the proud owner of a space agency staffed by the best Kerbal astronauts on this side of Kerbin!
  
It's currently named "Kerbal Space Agency" but feel free to come up with something more stellar.
Menu/NewCampaign/Campaign Name Menu Desc: We have set you up with a campaign name to start with. But feel free to enter a new and exciting campaign name for your adventures!
Menu/NewCampaign/CampaignDeletion: Are you sure you want to delete this campaign?
Menu/NewCampaign/CampaignNameOverwrite: Do you want to overwrite your existing campaign with the same name? Once you do there is no going back.
Menu/NewCampaign/CreateCampaignMenuWarni: You already have a campaign with this name.
You must select a Game Mode.
Menu/NewCampaign/ErrorMessageInvalidChar: Your campaign name cannot use any of the following characters: {0}
Menu/NewCampaign/Exploration Description:
- Earn Science by performning experiments
  - Spend Science to unlock new technologies and vehicle parts
  - Discover celestial bodies and resources
- Spend resources to create vehicles
  - Undertake missions
  - Earn Achievements
Menu/SaveLoad/DeleteGameWarning: Are you sure that you want to delete this game?
Menu/SaveLoad/OverwriteExistingSave: Existing saved games | Select to overwrite
Menu/SaveLoad/OverwriteGameWarning: Do you want to overwrite an existing game with the same name?
Menu/SaveLoad/OverwriteHeader: Existing Saved Games | Select To Overwrite
Menu/Settings/Change keybind instruction:
To update keybinds, select the input window and press the key you want to assign.

For keybinds with two inputs, select the input window and then press a key for each input.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/AFK Audio: When enabled, sound will play when the game is in the background.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/AllowRevert: Allow reversion of flights to launchpad or VAB.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Anisotropic F: Improve sharpness at distance and odd angles. Turning AF on may impact performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Audio Channel: Set how audio channels will be used.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Audio Listeni: Choose from Home Theater, Normal, Night Mode, or Headphones.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Cloud Quality: Alter the appearance of clouds. Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Difficulty:
Your current difficulty level. 

This may be customized by adjusting any of the settings below.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/EVA/MoveUpDow: Translate Up and Down while EVA Jetpack is enabled
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/EVA/RotatePit: Pitch Forward and Backward while EVA Jetpack is enabled
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/EVA/RotateRol: Roll Left and Right while EVA Jetpack is enabled
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/EVA/RotateYaw: Yaw Left and Right while EVA Jetpack is enabled
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Environment P:
Environment Props are the random rocks and trees scattered around the terrain. 

Toggle Environment Props on/off.

Toggling Environment Props off may improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/Camera: Toggle mouse sensitivity to perform precision movements
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/FocusN: Cycle forward to control another vessel in range.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/FocusP: Cycle backwards to control another vessel in range.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/Toggle: Toggle the appearance of the flight HUD.
Toggle mouse to control camera look.
Toggle keyboard sensitivity to perform precision movements.
Toggle the swapping of translation and rotation controls, useful for docking.
Toggles the appearance of labels for nearby inactive vessel and debris.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/Transl: Translate Left and Right using RCS
Translate Up and Down using RCS
Translate Forward and Backward using RCS
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/TrimMo: While held, movement controls will apply trim, constantly applying that movement.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/WheelB: While held, engage the Brakes Action Group.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Flight/Toggle: Unlocks camera from anchor point. Resetting the camera will disable Free Camera.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Game Screen M: Set how the game window will be presented.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Global/Toggle: Toggle appearance of the Escape Menu
Toggle appearance of the in-game Cheat Menu
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/GroundShading: Adjusts the realism of the terrain features. Higher settings improve visuals and will impact performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/HeatEnabled: Parts can gain heat, overheat, and be destroyed.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/HeatScaling: Scale how much heat is applied.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/HeatPartDestr: Parts will overheat and be destroyed.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/IncludeStockV: Have access to a variety of stock vessels.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Kerbal Commun: Adjust the Kerbal Communication chatter level.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Kerbal IVA: Adjusts the Kerbal IVA sound levels.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Language: Select the language for all in-game text. Voice is not affected.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Max Patches t: Set how many patches are shown for map trajectories.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Max Persistan:
Adjust the maximum amount of debris that may be present. Lower settings can improve performance.

This setting is applied immediately and may result in unintended destruction of debris.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/No Crash Dama: Parts are not destroyed on heavy impacts.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/cameraFas: Speed up camera interactions while held.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/copy: Copy currently selected or held assembly.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/resetCame: Reset camera to default position and orientation
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/rotatePit: Pitch held part forward and backwards.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/rotateRol: Roll held part left and right.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/rotateYaw: Yaw held part left and right.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/selectAll: Select all parts in the Launch Assembly.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/OAB/toggleFra: Toggle rotational frame of reference between local and world.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/PC: Adjust all graphics settings to a pre-set.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/CommNetRequir: Probe cores must have a signal back to KSC to maintain control.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Ring FX Quali: Alter the appearance of planetary rings. Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Scatter Densi:
Environment Props are the random rocks and trees scattered around the terrain. 

Toggle Environment Prop density low, medium, or high. 

Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/ScatterClutte:
Scatter are small environmental objects such as rocks and trees.

Lower settings can improve performance.

Environment Props are the random rocks and trees scattered around the terrain. 

Toggle Environment Prop draw distance low, medium, or high. 

Lower settings can improve performance.

Scatter are small environmental objects such as rocks and trees.

Adjust the visual quality of scatter at distance. Lower settings can improve performance.

Scatter are small environmental objects such as rocks and trees.

Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Shadow Detail: Adjust shadow detail. Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Shadow Qualit: Adjust shadow quality. Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Show FPS: Toggle appearance of Frames Per Second (FPS).
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Show Vessel L: Toggle apperance of labels for nearby vessels.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Skip Launch S: Skip the launch sequence when launching from a launchpad.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Sub-Title Tex: Adjust size of video subtitle text.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Tab Away Audi: Allow game sound to play while in the background
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Temperature G: Toggle appearance of temperature gauges when parts receive a dangerous amount of heat.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/TextureQualit: The resolution of the textures applied to 3D objects. Higher is crisper textures, but more VRAM usage.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/DockingTolera: Scale how far docking ports can be from each other to finalize docking.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/UI Sounds: Adjusts the User Interface sound levels.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/UnbreakableJo: Joints between vehicle parts cannot be broken by forces.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/V-Sync:
Synchronize frame rate to monitor refresh rate.

Enable if you are experiencing screen tearing.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/cameraFas: Speed up camera interactions while held.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/copy: Copy currently selected or held assembly.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/resetCame: Reset camera to default position and orientation
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/rotatePit: Pitch held part forward and backwards.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/rotateRol: Roll held part left and right.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/rotateYaw: Yaw held part left and right.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/selectAll: Select all parts in the Launch Assembly.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VAB/toggleFra: Toggle rotational frame of reference between local and world.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/VO Level: Adjusts the voice over sound level.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Verbose Loggi: Adds additional information to the KSP log file.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Water Details: Adjust the appearance of water details. Lower settings can improve performance.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Water Quality: Adjust the visual quality of water. Lower settings can improve performance.

Menu/TrackingStation/ConfirmationDialog/: Do you really wish to destroy {0}?
Do you really wish to recover {0}?
Menu/TrackingStation/ObjectPicker/EmptyF:
Want to keep your favorite objects handy?
  Press MMB to favorite an object.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Axod: Want to see the highest cliffs Kerbalkind has ever seen? Visit Axod! This dwarf planet’s severe axial tilt and fast rotation speed caused its hemispheres to offset over time, leading to its unique shape and cliff faces. Many extreme sports personalities, including Flamin' Fredricka Kerman, have requested transport here, hoping to perform the insane stunts with Axod’s ring system and small moon, Umod, in the background.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Bis: While sifting through possible names for this ball of ice, we nicknamed it “B-Ice.” We then collectively forgot about any other option. Bis has a crust made of ammonia, water, and nitrogen ices, which conceal the liquid ocean beneath. Cryovolcanic activity creates the drama on this moon from its erupting geysers to the crimson stains in the canyons. If you find yourself in orbit, you might even catch a glimpse of its thin atmosphere.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Bop: “What, did Bop cross your path?” You might hear this if you’ve been unlucky or had a bad night’s sleep. Kerbalkind legend says this mishappen moon is the home of the infamous Kraken! The impact crater comprising a sixth of its surface is likely the root of the association with the ship-destroying demon. This lore, along with its low gravity, makes this lumpy asteroid a haven for Kraken covens and skateboarding tournaments alike!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Dres: A dwarf planet, Dres has the gravitational pull to round itself out as it orbits the sun, but it doesn't rule its inclined, eccentric orbit like a proper planet. It is content to ‘hang out’ with other space objects, rather than tell them to become moons or get lost. Dres is also home to a lovely ring system and rad equatorial ridge! How unique!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Duna: Duna, The Reddest Planet, has long been an object of study and inspiration to Kerbal scientists and artists alike! Its thin, low-pressure atmosphere allows for both aerobraking and relatively easy access to its surface. Kerbal researchers and sci-fi writers often discuss the discoveries that could be waiting for them in the planet’s polar ice caps or on Duna’s tidally locked moon, Ike.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Eeloo: Eeloo is Kerbol’s most distant orbiting body. This dwarf planet seems to enjoy its lonely, highly eccentric orbit, though it does dip into Jool’s for brief visits. Missions here are costly, given Eeloo’s orbit, low gravity, lack of atmosphere, and spotty solar power potential. Even so, the difficult trip is worth it to see the frozen cliffs up close!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Eve: Eve’s gorgeous cloud cover, picturesque liquid-sulfur oceans, and cute moon give the impression of an ideal tourist hotspot. Unfortunately, Eve’s intense gravitational pull and dense, high-pressure atmosphere tend to turn visits into one-way trips. As our engineers say, “Come for the views, stay because your ship exploded on entry.”
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Gilly: Gilly is the smallest celestial body in the Kerbollar system. In fact, it took years to officially discover because researchers mistook it for a crumb on their telescope lenses. Its gentle gravitational pull and lack of atmosphere often leads to objects bouncing off its surface and back into orbit around Eve. Please be cautious when taking brisk walks.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Ike: Ike loves visitors, even when said visitors were planning to go to Duna. Its relatively large SOI, lack of atmosphere and geostationary orbit make it a breeze to bump into this tidally-locked moon. If you find yourself crashing there, let us know. We'd love more data on Ike’s dormant stratovolcanoes and mostly untouched ashfall regions. Oh, and we'll set up a rescue operation.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Jool: By far the flashiest planet in the Kerbollar system, Jool is a gas giant with massive gravitational pull and five moons! There is no land to land on, and the atmospheric pressure destroys anything Kerbals throw towards its center; however, the upper layers of clouds are ripe for study and watercolor paintings.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Kerbin: Even as rockets and probes escape its atmosphere for deep space exploration, there is still much appreciate about this vibrant world. Its vast oceans, deserts, forests, and plains coat the surface in lively beauty. Its moons, Mun and Minmus, swirl silently above it. Kerbalkind is fortunate to call this pale blue planet their home.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Kerbol: The object so iconic, only the coolest beings revolve around it! This enormous glowing orb of plasma is one-hundred times larger than Kerbin, and its mass creates the gravitational well which houses its seven planets and their respective moons. Despite its mesmerizing aura, Kerbal Space Program's Legal Welfare Team would like to take this moment to remind you: do not stare at the sun.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Laythe: Do you like gleaming oceans, sandy beaches, and breathable air? Pack your bags and take a trip to the Jewel of Jool, Laythe! The Kerbin-like atmospheric density is sure to keep you comfortable, whether you’re picnicking on the shore or studying impact craters. If it ever feels too familiar, just look up to enjoy a stunning view of the resident giant green gas giant!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Minmus: Kerbin’s second moon, Minmus, was long overlooked as most believed it was only a dead pixel or dust, much like Gilly. Despite the challenges of visiting it in its slightly inclined orbit, scientists were eager to study Minmus’ fascinating geology, especially after seeing its impossible ice-like surface. Further analysis led researchers to conclude that the "ice" is actually glass, much to the dismay of Minmus’s Mystic Crunch Milkshakes.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Moho: Most Moho missions crumble early on because of the logistics. It zips along an inclined, eccentric orbit, making interception a nightmare! If you make it into Moho’s SOI, there’s no atmosphere for aerobraking, and there’s severe heat on its sunny side, due to it being tidally locked with Kerbol. But imagine beholding those craters in person!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Mun: Kerbin’s closest extrakerbestrial body, the Mun is a prime destination for early space missions. Its orbit’s inclination and eccentricity match Kerbin’s, so SOI transfers are as easy as forgetting ladders! Explore the scars of impact collisions and ancient tectonic activity on its surface, or give it a wave as your vessel slingshots past it into the rest of the system!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Pol: Jool’s smallest moon is bursting with geothermal activity. Sulfuric compounds spew from volcanos while deposits of sulfur dioxide ices create small spires along the surface. Pol’s bright yellow appearance and low gravity, as well as the spikes, give it a “don’t come near me” vibe. We’re also getting radiation readings from it, so maybe Pol really doesn't want us around!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Tylo: If you ever want to visit Jool, you’ll need to know about Tylo, its third moon! It’s about as large as Kerbin with less mass and relatively strong gravity. This makes it ideal for gravity assists into and out of Jool’s sphere of influence! Tylo has no atmosphere, so attempting to land on it takes a good chunk of fuel. Oh, and I could have sworn it used to be more gray?
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Vall: Vall, "The Frozen Wonderland," is the second moon orbiting Jool. The icy surface covers a liquid water ocean, which occasionally bubbles out of its many cryovolcanoes. Tidally locked to its parent planet, Vall’s Jool-facing side is slightly warmed by radiation as it orbits. If you’ve wondered why some of the ice mountains can skewer your vessels and others seem smoother, now you know!
Menu/TrainingCenter/Game pause info: Your game will be paused while in the Tutorial
Menu/VAB/Delete: Do you want to delete your existing vehicle build?
Menu/VAB/DeleteWorkspace: Do you want to delete this workspace?
Menu/VAB/InvalidFairingWarning: Cannot Accept current changes. Fairing is colliding with invalid assembly part.
Menu/VAB/LaunchCollision: Your current launch assembly may collide at launch position and cause an explosion. Do you still want to launch it?
Menu/VAB/LaunchNotEnoughResources: Cannot launch vessel, it requires more resources than are currently available in VAB. Do you want to save it for later?
Menu/VAB/LaunchOversizedAssembly: Can't Launch vessel, it exceeds the size limits of the current VAB. Do you want to Save it for later?
Menu/VAB/LaunchTooltip: See Engineer's Report for error details
Menu/VAB/NoCommandModuleWarning: Your vehicle will not be controllable without a command module. Do you want to launch anyway?
Menu/VAB/NotEnoughResourcesOnLoad: This save file requires more resources than available in current VAB! You can still load and work on it. You cannot launch if there are not enough resources.
Menu/VAB/OccupiedLaunchpadWarning: Selected launchpad is occupied. Do you want to clear the launchpad?
Menu/VAB/OversizedLoad: This save file is oversized for current VAB! You can still load and work on it. You cannot launch if it's oversized.
Menu/VAB/OverwriteSave: Do you want to overwrite your existing vehicle build with the same name?
Menu/VAB/RecoveryMessageBox/Body: Would you like to recover {0} from {1}?
Menu/VAB/ResourceWarning: Cannot launch due to resource cost
Menu/VAB/SizeResourceWarning: Cannot launch due to size/resource cost
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Show Navball: Show the Navball and its related instruments while in Map view.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Default Throt: Sets initial throttle for launched vehicles.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/Activate Tool: Enable detailed information while hovering over specific user interface elements
Menu/SaveLoad/EmptySaveFileNameWarning: Unable to create save file! (file name is empty)
Menu/SaveLoad/InvalidCharacterSaveFileNa: Your save-file name cannot use any of the following characters: {0}
Menu/Main/SeizureWarningText: IMPORTANT HEALTH WARNING: READ BEFORE PLAYING A very small percentage of individuals may experience epileptic seizures when exposed to certain light patterns or flashing lights, including some of the visual effects that appear in certain video games. Symptoms may even be experienced by individuals with no history of epilepsy or photosensitivity. If you or anyone in your family have an epileptic or photosensitivity condition, please consult your physician before playing. If you experience any of the following symptoms while playing this video game, immediately discontinue use and consult your physician before resuming play: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitches, loss of awareness, disorientation, any involuntary movement, or convulsions.
Menu/Main/SeizureWarningTitle: IMPORTANT HEALTH WARNING: READ BEFORE PLAYING
Menu/DifficultyMenu/InformationWindow/Pa: Impacts the g-force tolerance of parts
Menu/DifficultyMenu/InformationWindow/St: The amount of Science players start with.
Menu/KSC/R&D Description: At the R&D Center, our team of scientists works hard to crunch the data received from mission experiments.
Menu/NewCampaign/Replay Mode Disabled: No replay files. You can not start game in replay mode
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Dod: That’s no moon! Not a natural one, at least. Did you see the pulsating blue glow around those hexagonal bits. Looks like electromagnetic radiation, which suggests it’s producing oodles of energy. The structure's surface appears uniform, but there's one spot that breaks the pattern! Would you be willing to risk a teeny-tiny bit of radiation sickness to take a closer look?
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Drayda: Never has a planet caused such a stir in the KSC! What is this world? How did it get here? This mysterious planet is situated in interstellar space, frozen and seemingly adrift. About the size of Kerbin, Drayda also shares the home world’s nitrogen and oxygen atmosphere, although it's a bit too cold for clouds to form. Only mountains and inactive volcanoes peek through the ice, although one towers above the rest.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Flot: If you looked at Flot while stuck on a raft in Rem’s ocean, you’d see this moon’s fluffy water clouds, stunning greenery, and vast system of blue rivers. Flot’s thick oxygen atmosphere and abundance of water provide the perfect conditions for vegetation and other types of life. The circular lake areas are deep, water-filled impact craters. Most of the rivers are quite shallow, so no diving!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Glumo: Groovy Glumo is truly a gem of a gas giant! Between its iconic ring system and two satellites, Merbel and Noj, there’s no place quite as dazzling. Its gaseous outer layer contains water, ammonia, and ammonium hydrosulfide ices, hidden in enchanting clouds that may remind you of your aunt’s house for some reason. If you find yourself near Glumo’s rings, avoid the ice crystals lest you be crushed, julienned, and/or pureed by debris.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Hurr: Looking for a place to generate wind power? Well, there's no place as blustery as Hurr, thanks to its extreme temperatures and dense atmosphere! Tidally-locked with Tuun, the sun-facing side experiences scorching heat while the dark side is one large sheet of ice and debris. It seems to give our instruments some trouble upon occasion, but we're still looking into that. In short, freezy, breezy, unmerciful: Hurr.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Lapat: Lapat is covered in a thick, carbon dioxide atmosphere, wrapping it in a mysterious (some would say eerie) shroud. Placid water lakes and white sand swathe its smoggy surface, while striking dark mesas reach high into the sky. These towers stand tall enough to escape the oppressive atmospheric density around their bases. Please catalogue your emotional state upon beholding Lapat’s features for promotional purposes.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Merbel: Merbel went a different aesthetic direction from other celestial bodies. An equatorial sea of liquid methane and ammonia between two ice caps? It’s a a bold look, and we have sun exposure to thank. The moon’s dizzying rotation speed, one-degree axial tilt, and equatorial orbit means Merbel’s equator gets a lot of Tuun’s attention. If thick blue belts show up on fashion runways this season, you’ll know which cosmic icon inspired it!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Noj: Noj is a shepherd moon formed by the accretion of ice and other matter encountered while orbiting Glumo’s ring system. Dust and other impurities stain the gathered ice to create the lovely pops of color throughout the surface. Pretty colors aside, our scientists can’t shut up about the initial readings from Noj, and they desperately want more data. We’ll have your team medically examined before and after visits, so no need for concern!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Puf: The iris of Puf isn’t just a gorgeous lake: it’s the deepest sea Kerbalkind has ever encountered! These depths were likely formed by an asteroid carving through Puf’s soft, low-density surface and tilting the planet's axis while it was at it. Puf has a thin methane atmosphere and very low gravity for a planet its size, so be prepared for your landers to bounce back into orbit around this Great Eye.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Qeg: Qeg is a 7.5 billion year old red giant that is 1.1 Kerbol masses, but 20x the radius of Kerbol. Qeg is slightly redder than Kerbol, and twice as luminous. Qeg’s features are based on predictions of the evolution of our own sun as it exhausts its hydrogen and begins to expand.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Rask: Rask and Rusk were born after their parent protoplanet was sheered in two. The larger of the pair, Rask has a smaller lava sea and less magma bubbling to the surface due to the decreased impact of tidal forces. Be careful with your orbit if you decide to visit. Rask and Rusk are greedy and love to snatch satellites from each other!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Rem: Hope you like an ocean view! With more than two times the mass of Kerbin and an oxygen atmosphere, the warm and watery planet of Rem has no solid surface above the waves. Sadly, we don’t know much other than that. There are mesas close enough to ocean’s surface that a clever Kerbal could build a platform above the water, but there’s no way to lift off again if that doesn’t work out. Pack your life jacket!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Rusk: Rusk is Rask’s smaller twin. Tidal forces draw Rusk’s inner magma ocean to the surface, resulting a lava sea on the side facing its tidally locked twin. Within this sea are unique rock spires, which can reach several kilometers above the surface. Not to be outdone, Rusk's other side covered in marvelous lava lakes, making this planet the perfect getaway destination for volcanologists and Kerbals who are perpetually too cold.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Skut: Check out this funky hunk of rock! See how it looks like two asteroids fused together? Well, that’s probably what happened! If Skut is a massive, captured asteroid, that also explains its extremely eccentric orbit, swinging dangerously close to Tuun’s surface and then flinging itself into outer reaches of the system. Maybe it can’t quite make up its mind about where to set the thermostat.
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Tuun: Hotter, brighter, mass-ier: Tuun is an F-type star with a larger Goldilocks zone than any other star system in the known Kerbalverse. This zone indicates the area within the Tuun’s sphere of influence where planets are warm enough to have liquid water. Meaning, Tuun has more potential for life than even the Kerbolar system! Who knows, maybe you’ll turn over a rock and find a teeny-tiny space center!
Menu/TrackingStation/Synopsis/Verda: Verda is...cloudy. Overcast. Judging by the cloud cover, it probably has a good amount of water on its surface. Unfortunately, that’s about all we know, because we can’t get a good look beyond the atmosphere. Verda could be the first planet made entirely out of noodles, and we wouldn’t know until we landed. Based on its proximity to Tuun, it’s likely warm and could possibly support noodly life.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/RD/expandPart: Expands the part tooltip in the R&D Center to show additional info.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/RD/ScrollTech: Scrolls the tech tree in the R&D Center.
Menu/KSC/LockedBuilding Description: This building is only available in Exploration Mode.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/EnhanceJoints:
The Enhanced Joints System adds additional joints across each vessel to improve the rigidity and performance of vessels.

When this is enabled, the Multi-Joint System is usually best turned off to reduce PhysX load.

The chosen option here controls what part in a vessel any additional joints will connect to:

* Heaviest: connect to the part with the greatest mass.
* Root: connect to the part that represents the vessel.
* GrandParent: connect to the part that is 2 parts closer to the root.
Menu/Settings/Descriptions/MultiJointEna:
The Multi-Joint system adds a ring of joints at configured part to part connections.

These are preconfigured joints on specific parts and not dynamic like the Enhanced Joints System.
Menu/Escape/VesselLossWarningBody: The vessel you're piloting is in a dangerous state. This vessel will be destroyed if you leave this flight. Do you still want to leave?
